page.title: 05Chew Stoke (cont.)
page.content: {Chew Stoke}today is a lively village for both young and old. The primary school is flourishing and generally feeds the local comprehensive school - {Chew Valley}although some children travel into Bristol, Bath & Wells for private education. There is a weekly visit from the{Y.T.S.}for unemployed teenagers. The{mobile library}calls every 2wks. The over 60's club for retired people has recently become the{over 50's club}to for those people who have taken early retirement. The {W.R.V.S.}is very active in the village including delivering{meals on {wheels}to the elderly there is a W.I. which meets in the Church Hall, a{Tug {of War team,}a competent{bell ringing {band.}The village is the home of {Biblie Society}which traces clocks. There is:{post office}and a{general {store.}The electors list has 649 names
